meetings.title: Product Review - Strategic Optimization, TimeZone, Weather Layer, Facility Snapshot

topics.label: TimeZone Architecture - Frontend vs Backend Responsibilities
Strategic Optimization - Map Tab with Routes Display
Map Layers Organization and Location Entity Naming

decisions.description: All TimeZone calculations, Time Window processing, and string processing must be handled by Backend, not Frontend. TimeZones must be configurable in organizational administrative settings with default behavior options (user TimeZone, depot TimeZone, or Facility TimeZone).
decisions.rationale: Current Frontend-based TimeZone handling violates MVC and architectural principles, creates inconsistency between Frontend and other access methods (SDK, Web Service, mobile app), and causes performance issues when handling large datasets. Backend must handle this for consistency across all client types and to maintain architectural integrity. [CRITICAL_ARCHITECTURAL_DIRECTIVE]

decisions.description: Rename Telematics Gateway section to "Integrations Gateway" or "Connections" with Connection Type dropdown, consolidating all gateway types (Telematics, ERP, CRM) into single unified section. Add columns showing synced object types (orders, vehicles, customers, customer locations, items, assets).
decisions.rationale: No business need for multiple separate gateway sections when all gateways share same architectural pattern. Single section with type selector provides cleaner UX and prevents interface bloat. Dimensional data objects (orders, vehicles, customers, etc.) cover 99% of integration use cases. [CEO_STRATEGIC_DIRECTIVE]
alternatives: Keep separate sections for each gateway type

decisions.description: Log all outgoing (egress) webhooks in addition to incoming webhooks, including full payload contents. Provide users with example payloads/schemas to understand integration structure and enable API testing directly from Route4Me system.
decisions.rationale: Users need visibility into what data Route4Me sends to their systems (ERP, CRM, etc.) for debugging, validation, and testing purposes. Integration checker requires sample payloads for testing. Full bidirectional webhook logging necessary for enterprise integrations. [CEO_TECHNICAL_REQUIREMENT]

decisions.description: Use proper rounding for percentage values (not truncation) and add percent symbol to make clear values are percentages. Keep one decimal place to avoid "missing percent" confusion.
decisions.rationale: Current truncation causes percents to not add up to 100% (confusion). Proper rounding solves this. Percent symbol needed for clarity. [MINOR_UX_FIX]

decisions.description: Add future "Summary" tab showing histogram/table view of scenarios grouped by quality metrics (% routed, % unrouted, etc.) with deep-link filtering to drill into specific scenario groups. Enables rapid analysis when testing hundreds of scenarios with different parameters.
decisions.rationale: When users generate 50-250 scenarios testing different parameters (visit frequency, working days, vehicle count, etc.), they need quick way to identify best/worst performers without manually reviewing each scenario. Histogram with filters provides instant insight into results distribution. [CEO_PRODUCT_VISION]

decisions.description: Implement Map tab with intelligent rendering - use clustering for dense areas, pagination for large datasets, and heatmap visualization option. Do not render all locations simultaneously when dealing with hundreds of thousands of addresses.
decisions.rationale: Performance requirements dictate that Frontend cannot hold and render massive datasets (150K+ addresses) all at once. Need pagination, clustering, and heatmap modes for different use cases and data volumes. Consistent with TimeZone architectural directive about moving heavy processing to Backend. [EXECUTING_CEO_DIRECTIVE]

decisions.description: Applied Settings tab displays all configuration parameters used in optimization with clear indication of source (organizational default, facility override, optimization-specific override). Settings inherit from organizational level but can be overridden at optimization level.
decisions.rationale: Users need transparency into which settings were applied and why. Inheritance pattern (organization → facility → optimization) provides flexibility while maintaining consistency. Clear override indicators prevent confusion about where settings came from. [CEO_APPROVED]

decisions.description: Implement TimeZone selector component that allows users to choose organizational default TimeZone preference (user TimeZone, depot TimeZone, facility TimeZone, or custom). All TimeZone calculations happen on Backend. Frontend component only sends preference and displays times in selected TimeZone.
decisions.decided_by: Dan Khasis, Igor Skrynkovskyy, Manar Kurmanov
decisions.rationale: Executing CEO's architectural directive that Backend must own TimeZone logic. Component provides user control while Backend ensures consistency across all access methods (web, mobile, API, SDK). Proper abstraction separates display (Frontend) from calculation (Backend). [EXECUTING_CEO_DIRECTIVE]

decisions.description: Add forecast slider to Weather Layer allowing users to see predicted weather conditions at any point in route timeline. Slider scrubs through time showing weather overlay on map for selected forecast hour. Data refreshes based on API limits and cost considerations.
decisions.rationale: Weather forecast at specific route time is more valuable than current weather. Users need to see weather conditions when driver will actually be at location (e.g., "will it rain at 2 PM when we're delivering?"). Slider provides intuitive time-based weather exploration. [CEO_APPROVED]

decisions.description: Position Weather Layer as premium feature for enterprise customers. Target industries most weather-dependent (construction, utilities, field service, delivery). Pricing separate from core routing to capture additional value.
decisions.rationale: Weather Layer has real API costs (data providers charge per request). Enterprise customers in weather-sensitive industries willing to pay premium for accurate forecast integration. Competitive analysis shows few competitors have this capability. Strong sales differentiat or. [CEO_STRATEGIC_DECISION]

decisions.description: Facility Snapshot is immutable point-in-time copy of facility data. Must clearly indicate "Snapshot" vs live "Location" data in UI. Snapshots support versioning, comparison between versions, and full audit trail of what changed since previous Snapshot. Once created, Snapshot never changes - new updates create new Snapshot version.
decisions.decided_by: Dan Khasis, Alexey Gusentsov, Semeyon S
decisions.rationale: Users need historical view of facility data for analysis, compliance, and troubleshooting. "Snapshot" naming makes clear this is frozen historical data, not live current data. Immutability ensures Snapshot integrity for audit purposes. Versioning enables trend analysis and change tracking. [CEO_TECHNICAL_REQUIREMENT]

decisions.description: Restructure Map Layers to eliminate naming confusion. Top-level items are entity types (locations, facilities, assets, vehicles). Under each entity, sub-options for display mode (clustering, heatmap). Remove separate "locations" section. Map Layers shows data from database. Distinguish newly imported locations with qualifying label.
decisions.rationale: Current structure causes confusion - "locations" appears in multiple places with unclear meaning. Users confused whether seeing imported data vs database data. Clear hierarchy (entity type → display mode) eliminates ambiguity. Qualifier "newly imported" makes distinction clear. [CEO_UX_DIRECTIVE]
alternatives: Keep current structure with better labels
Completely separate imported vs database views

action_items.description: Implement TimeZone calculation and Time Window processing on Backend
Remove TimeZone business logic from Frontend and call Backend for calculations
Create organizational configuration for TimeZone settings with default behavior options
Rename Telematics Gateway section to Connections or Integrations Gateway
Add Connection Type selector dropdown
Add columns for dimensional data object counts (orders, vehicles, customers, locations, items, assets)
Update support pages and documentation with new naming
Ensure egress webhooks logged to BigQuery with full payload
Create UI to display webhook payload examples and schemas
Implement integration checker/tester functionality
Implement proper rounding (not truncation) for percentage values
Add percent symbol (%) to percentage displays
Design Summary tab with histogram visualization for scenario quality distribution
Implement Summary tab with deep-link filtering to scenario groups
Optimize scenario generation for parallel processing to handle 100+ scenarios efficiently
Implement map pagination for large location datasets
Add clustering mode for dense location areas
Add heatmap visualization option
Complete Applied Settings tab implementation with inheritance display
Add clear visual indicators for setting overrides vs defaults
Ensure organizational default settings properly cascade to facility and optimization levels
Complete TimeZone selector component with organizational defaults
Implement TimeZone calculation API that Frontend calls
Design TimeZone selector UI with clear indication of current setting and source
Create test scenarios covering DST transitions and all TimeZone conversion edge cases
Complete Weather Layer forecast slider implementation
Finalize forecast slider UI design with timeline integration
Implement weather data refresh logic balancing accuracy vs API costs
Develop Weather Layer sales positioning and pricing strategy
Define Weather Layer packaging tiers and customer segments
Implement Facility Snapshot with clear Snapshot vs Location naming
Add Snapshot versioning and version history display
Implement Snapshot generation process and immutability enforcement
Create Snapshot comparison API for version-to-version diff
Implement full audit trail for Snapshot changes
Redesign Map Layers structure with entity types as parents and display modes as children
Implement restructured Map Layers UI
Add "newly imported locations" qualifier to distinguish from database locations
Create clear visual distinction between imported and database location layers

properties.label: TimeZone Handling Must Move to Backend
Rename Telematics Gateway to Integrations/Connections Gateway
Add egress webhook logging and payload examples
Future summary tab for scenario histogram analysis
Facility Snapshot data model and naming
Map Layers restructuring and naming resolution
